main event: A bright circular light was observed in the sky in Covington, Kentucky on July 6, 1967. The light remained stationary for several minutes before suddenly disappearing.
interesting points: The object was described as being larger than a star and brighter.
The witness could not determine the precise size, altitude or distance of the object.
The object remained stationary for several minutes before suddenly disappearing.
The weather conditions were clear skies.
The witness appears to be reliable.
sighted object: a bright circular light in the sky
